recount3 0.99.0

Create a recount3 RangedSummarizedExperiment gene or exon object

Source: R/create_rse.R
create_rse.Rd

Once you have identified a project you want to work with, you can use this function to construct a recount3 RangedSummarizedExperiment-class (RSE) object at the gene or exon expression feature level. This function will retrieve the data, cache it, then assemble the RSE object.

create_rse(
  project_info,
  type = c("gene", "exon"),
  annotation = annotation_options(project_info$organism),
  bfc = BiocFileCache::BiocFileCache(),
  recount3_url = "http://snaptron.cs.jhu.edu/data/temp/recount3"
)

Arguments

project_info

A data.frame() with one row that contains the information for the project you are interested in. You can find which project to work on using todo().
type

A character(1) specifying whether you want to access gene counts or exon counts.
annotation

A character(1) specifying which annotation you want to download. Only used when type is either gene or exon.
bfc

A BiocFileCache-class object where the files will be cached to.
recount3_url

A character(1) specifying the home URL for recount3 or a local directory where you have mirrored recount3.

Value

A RangedSummarizedExperiment-class object.

Examples


## Find the project you are interested in
## (temporarily build this data.frame)
proj_info <- data.frame(
    project = "ERP110066",
    project_home = "data_sources/sra",
    organism = "human"
)

## Create a RSE object at the gene level
rse_gene_ERP110066 <- create_rse(proj_info)
#> using temporary cache /tmp/RtmpYnT3ao/BiocFileCache
#> adding rname 'http://snaptron.cs.jhu.edu/data/temp/recount3/human/data_sources'

#>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                <character>
#> ERR2713300 Cells  were treated with Accutase and, once obtained single cells, were filtered (40um strainers), counted and resuspended in PBS/BSA (at 1%) at 10^6/mL to sort them into 384-well plates (containing the lysis buffer and ERCCs). The hiPSC line FSPS13B was plated on vitronectin coated plates (10µg/ml, Stem Cell Technologies) and cultured in E6 media supplemented with 2ng/ml TGF-β (R&D) and 25ng/ml FGF2 making complete E8 media. Cells were maintained by weekly passaging using 0.5mM EDTA (Thermo Fisher Scientific). hiPSC colonies were treated with DMSO or 100ng/ml nocodazole for 16 hours. Following synchronisation, cells were maintained in pluripotency conditions or induced to form definitive endoderm using a 3-day protocol. On day 1 cells were cultured in CDM-PVA supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2, 10µM LY294002, 10ng/ml BMP4, 100ng/ml Activin A and 3µM CHIR99021. On day 2 the cells were cultured in CDM-PVA supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2, 10µM LY294002, 10ng/ml BMP4 and 100ng/ml Activin A. On day 3 the cells were cultured in RPMI-B27 media supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2 and 100ng/ml Activin. Conversion was performed following the SMART-Seq2 protocol (https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2014.006) using a poly-Dt30 oligo and a TSO oligo. RNA extraction is based on the Picelli et al SS2 protocol, using a polydT primer plus the template switching oligo – TSO, as published (https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2014.006). Cell sorting and library preparation was carried out by the sequencing core facility at the Wellcome Sanger Institute. Single hPSCs were isolated into 384 wells plates and libraries were prepared for 120 cells/per condition using the SMART-Seq2 protocol (https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2014.006) and using Nextera XT DNA Library Preparation Kit – Illumina. A constant amount of spike-in RNA from the External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) was also added to the lysis buffer prior to sorting.
#> ERR2713800 Cells  were treated with Accutase and, once obtained single cells, were filtered (40um strainers), counted and resuspended in PBS/BSA (at 1%) at 10^6/mL to sort them into 384-well plates (containing the lysis buffer and ERCCs). The hiPSC line FSPS13B was plated on vitronectin coated plates (10µg/ml, Stem Cell Technologies) and cultured in E6 media supplemented with 2ng/ml TGF-β (R&D) and 25ng/ml FGF2 making complete E8 media. Cells were maintained by weekly passaging using 0.5mM EDTA (Thermo Fisher Scientific). hiPSC colonies were treated with DMSO or 100ng/ml nocodazole for 16 hours. Following synchronisation, cells were maintained in pluripotency conditions or induced to form definitive endoderm using a 3-day protocol. On day 1 cells were cultured in CDM-PVA supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2, 10µM LY294002, 10ng/ml BMP4, 100ng/ml Activin A and 3µM CHIR99021. On day 2 the cells were cultured in CDM-PVA supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2, 10µM LY294002, 10ng/ml BMP4 and 100ng/ml Activin A. On day 3 the cells were cultured in RPMI-B27 media supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2 and 100ng/ml Activin. Conversion was performed following the SMART-Seq2 protocol (https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2014.006) using a poly-Dt30 oligo and a TSO oligo. RNA extraction is based on the Picelli et al SS2 protocol, using a polydT primer plus the template switching oligo – TSO, as published (https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2014.006). Cell sorting and library preparation was carried out by the sequencing core facility at the Wellcome Sanger Institute. Single hPSCs were isolated into 384 wells plates and libraries were prepared for 120 cells/per condition using the SMART-Seq2 protocol (https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2014.006) and using Nextera XT DNA Library Preparation Kit – Illumina. A constant amount of spike-in RNA from the External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) was also added to the lysis buffer prior to sorting.
#> ERR2714100 Cells  were treated with Accutase and, once obtained single cells, were filtered (40um strainers), counted and resuspended in PBS/BSA (at 1%) at 10^6/mL to sort them into 384-well plates (containing the lysis buffer and ERCCs). The hiPSC line FSPS13B was plated on vitronectin coated plates (10µg/ml, Stem Cell Technologies) and cultured in E6 media supplemented with 2ng/ml TGF-β (R&D) and 25ng/ml FGF2 making complete E8 media. Cells were maintained by weekly passaging using 0.5mM EDTA (Thermo Fisher Scientific). hiPSC colonies were treated with DMSO or 100ng/ml nocodazole for 16 hours. Following synchronisation, cells were maintained in pluripotency conditions or induced to form definitive endoderm using a 3-day protocol. On day 1 cells were cultured in CDM-PVA supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2, 10µM LY294002, 10ng/ml BMP4, 100ng/ml Activin A and 3µM CHIR99021. On day 2 the cells were cultured in CDM-PVA supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2, 10µM LY294002, 10ng/ml BMP4 and 100ng/ml Activin A. On day 3 the cells were cultured in RPMI-B27 media supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2 and 100ng/ml Activin. Conversion was performed following the SMART-Seq2 protocol (https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2014.006) using a poly-Dt30 oligo and a TSO oligo. RNA extraction is based on the Picelli et al SS2 protocol, using a polydT primer plus the template switching oligo – TSO, as published (https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2014.006). Cell sorting and library preparation was carried out by the sequencing core facility at the Wellcome Sanger Institute. Single hPSCs were isolated into 384 wells plates and libraries were prepared for 120 cells/per condition using the SMART-Seq2 protocol (https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2014.006) and using Nextera XT DNA Library Preparation Kit – Illumina. A constant amount of spike-in RNA from the External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) was also added to the lysis buffer prior to sorting.

#> ERR2713600 Alias;;E-MTAB-7008:0hS_22728_4_108|Broker name;;ArrayExpress|cell_line;;HPSI0813i-fpdm_2|cell_type;;induced pluripotent stem cell|Description;;Protocols: Cells were treated with Accutase and, once obtained single cells, were filtered (40um strainers), counted and resuspended in PBS/BSA (at 1%) at 10^6/mL to sort them into 384-well plates (containing the lysis buffer and ERCCs). The hiPSC line FSPS13B was plated on vitronectin coated plates (10µg/ml, Stem Cell Technologies) and cultured in E6 media supplemented with 2ng/ml TGF-β (R&D) and 25ng/ml FGF2 making complete E8 media. Cells were maintained by weekly passaging using 0.5mM EDTA (Thermo Fisher Scientific). hiPSC colonies were treated with DMSO or 100ng/ml nocodazole for 16 hours. Following synchronisation, cells were maintained in pluripotency conditions or induced to form definitive endoderm using a 3-day protocol. On day 1 cells were cultured in CDM-PVA supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2, 10µM LY294002, 10ng/ml BMP4, 100ng/ml Activin A and 3µM CHIR99021. On day 2 the cells were cultured in CDM-PVA supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2, 10µM LY294002, 10ng/ml BMP4 and 100ng/ml Activin A. On day 3 the cells were cultured in RPMI-B27 media supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2 and 100ng/ml Activin. Conversion was performed following the SMART-Seq2 protocol (https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2014.006) using a poly-Dt30 oligo and a TSO oligo. RNA extraction is based on the Picelli et al SS2 protocol, using a polydT primer plus the template switching oligo - TSO, as published (https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2014.006). Cell sorting and library preparation was carried out by the sequencing core facility at the Wellcome Sanger Institute.
